Thanks for sending this through. Can you try now?
https://staging-stellainsurance-dec2022.kinsta.cloud/travel-insurance/claims/

Hi Joel,

These details should result in a successful submission on staging. STETI46137 1/1/1990

Upon testing a successful submission it is showing the below message and returning a message for an unsuccessful submission. This should show the successful message.


Secondly, It also appears the incorrect submission response has also been updated. This was fine previously. Below is what an incorrect response should show and it should leave the data on the form to be corrected, however it is now showing the above image and also clearing the data.


Best regards,

David

David Barnes

Chief Product Officer

Hi David,

We have updated the site. Let me know if this works for you? Also can you send a test data we could use?

https://staging-stellainsurance-dec2022.kinsta.cloud/travel-insurance/claims/

Hi Joel,

One further thing that we have noticed.

Upon successful submission of a claim, the page auto rolls to the top and the copy overlays the box instead of being seperate, so customers are missing the message and we are now seeing multiple submissions as customers keep pressing the submit button.



Updates required

- The page should roll to where the message is displayed
- The success message was separate from the bottom of the yellow box and sat above the image as seen here https://whimsical.com/claims-page-feedback-XAFzfj6MRW4t6gLN4evDBp@2bsEvpTYFZsxPdsfeyfA3TbcoHVr5zHd1JJ as it now hides some of the disclaimer and also gets lost on the page.
- If I remember, I believe that before, on successful submission, the copy on the page should clear, which would also indicate a success.

However if it is as quick to do the below, can we proceed with this

- The unsuccessful submission is working correctly and actually is really clear for the customer (red box and I icon). Would it be much additional work to reuse that component, but make it a green background with a tick, clear the information on the page and display the successful message in the green box when a successful submission takes place?


Best regards,

David

David Barnes

Chief Product Officer

Thanks
Rachel

Hi Rachel,

Confirming we have updated the script. Can you try now?

full_threads.body: Hi @joel need your help with this ticket. Thanks!

Hi,

We are seeing errors on the travel claims form for Stella Insurance.

In the request body sent to the api/v3/claimsupload/processandnotify endpoint, the format of the date in the dateReported field is incorrect. All dates in the request body should be in the format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss"

On the example request below which was submitted from https://staging-stellainsurance-dec2022.kinsta.cloud/travel-insurance/claims/, the month value is missing the leading 0 and should be "2024-02-20T00:00:00"

POST https://stella-test.au.aventus.app/api/v3/claimsupload/processandnotify
{
"policyReferenceID": "STETI46137",
"firstName": "r",
"lastName": "r",
"dateOfBirth": "1990-01-01T00:00:00",
"emailAddress": "rachel+claims@withstella.co",
"contactPhoneNumber": "0222222222",
"description": "test",
"dateOccurred": "2024-02-20T00:00:00",
"location": "home",
"claimValue": {
"value": "100",
"currencyCode": "AUD"
},
"dateReported": "2024-2-20T00:00:00"
}


Can this please be looked at and fixed.

Thanks,
Rachel

--

Rachel Robertson

Lead Architect
